Sample.Title: An Angular single-page application that authenticates users with Azure AD and calls a protected ASP.NET Core web API

ManualSteps.Comment: Navigate to the portal and change the 'signInAudeince' to 'AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount'  in the application manifest
Navigate to the portal and set the 'accessTokenAcceptedVersion' to '2'  in the application manifest
Navigate to the portal and change the 'signInAudeince' to 'AzureADandPersonalMicrosoftAccount'  in the application manifest
Navigate to the portal and set the 'accessTokenAcceptedVersion' to '2'  in the application manifest

Mappings.key: Enter the domain of your Azure AD tenant, e.g. 'contoso.onmicrosoft.com'
Enter the application ID (clientId) of the 'TodoListAPI' application copied from the Azure portal
Enter the Redirect Uri that you set on Azure Portal, like http://localhost:4200
Enter the Uri that you wish the app to redirect to after logout, like http://localhost:4200
Enter the TodoList Web APIs base address, e.g. 'https://localhost:44351/api/todolist/'
Enter the API scopes as declared in the app registration 'Expose an Api' blade in the form of 'api://{clientId}/access_as_user'
